intro: Securidaca surinamensis, commonly known as Surinam thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
